nodes.bodyText: shouldnt timeoutException thrown from bootstrapManagementServer be caught here?

I don't understand why we need to explicitly handle TimeoutException here. What about NetworkExceptions and other exceptions? Besides, the caller of this, namely BootstrapUtil.bootstrap() already logs and handles all exceptions: https://github.com/CorfuDB/CorfuDB/blob/master/runtime/src/main/java/org/corfudb/runtime/BootstrapUtil.java#L128-L134
you can change the test comments to reflect this new behaviour

Why specifically handling TimeoutException, there are other exceptions like NetworkException right? As explained in previous comment, the existing bootstrapLayoutServer implementation does return an exceptionally completed future due to CFUtil.unwrap(), I think the problem might not be here.
Ok, I see. I won't touch it then. I'll leave management and layout views as is but will unwrap the exception in the AddNode sendRequest I guess.

minor - the variable name bootstrapped is confusing here.  If the server is bootstrapped, we log the warning.  But the check appears to be doing the opposite.  You can change the name to something else.
I don't think swallowing all exceptions is a good idea. The retry only needs to happen on timeout and network exceptions.
Also, if this thread is interrupted, the interrupt flag isn't restored.
Ok, I'll bring it back in.
You can pass Network/Timeout exceptions types.
Ok, I see. I'll pass the Network and TimeOut types here and return the 3 exceptions.

I think later on there should a cleanup patch on all the inherited children of sendRequest because others are not taking care of NetworkException, and the signature suggests it only throws TimeoutException.
